document.title: WISCONSIN ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

C24567EE2D1A472B8662D92C2AD7A755.description:
Consult print in the environment to
support reading and spelling.

4C7C29A59DEA452F862F99CE9E2B799D.description:
Use spelling patterns in familiar
words with common spelling
patterns to spell words with the
same spelling pattern.

F68DA255126C4FFF833EDCC128C3B7A9.description:
Use resources as needed to spell
common high frequency words
accurately.

A43F27A6B9204FF7AE2C2A300DF16D50.description:
During shared writing, indicate the
need to add a period at the end of a
sentence.

ED37C07466464E168734DED4CEE2CB91.description:
Capitalize the first letter of familiar
names.

A299679C8FB148CD8F7F702105F515BD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
conventions of standardized English.

6E3FA3B425BB4D36B3E7E6AD34691EB6.description:
Uses noun + verb, noun + adjective,
and subject + verb + object
combinations in communication.

AE5FD60A69A54702B4FC027A501A336B.description: Use present and past tense verbs.

F8AA2BD77692402F90847C59AEACB7A9.description:
Use regular plural nouns in
communication.

7E33181732FE4FEAB11ED854B8400945.description:
Demonstrate standardized English
grammar and usage when communicating.

8F28B1556B9C48989485ED0574FA36C7.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
words that signal spatial and
temporal relationships (e.g., behind,
under, after, soon, next, later).

F783790F3D9F4EB8A729F1574A44C36C.description:
Use words acquired through
conversations, being read to, and during
shared reading activities.

70092DC8356B48BCBAA7D95AB4326C63.description:
Identify words that describe
personal emotional states.

E878469C6E154784A85DB3229D81A9D1.description:
Identify real-life connections
between words and their use (e.g.,
happy: “I am happy.”).

43558A25C14A467DB1163D39A5EA946B.description:
Determine the literal meaning of
words and phrases in context.

5FD00D6FB2284BF886A5FECE371A981B.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
word relationships and use.

AC404221A220415EAF31193F4C4A4FF8.description:
With guidance and support, identify
the temporal meaning of words
when common affixes (-ing, - ed) are
added to common verbs.

ADBC67CC720A411AA53B5700940929CB.description:
With guidance and support, use
sentence level context to determine
what word is missing from a
sentence read aloud.

940F1C9E170C453DB10A6DD250CFBC97.description:
Use language to make simple
requests, comment, or share
information.

CE3365B10F4E40B59977D6A5F97F67C6.description:
Use language to achieve desired
outcomes when communicating.

6E966C15AB234672AB39FBDF78453120.description:
Create a multimedia presentation
of a story or poem.

298EFBDCBA04463FAAB7B099A8A0E627.description:
Recount a personal experience,
story, poem, or topic including details.

DB9AE56AFA214BD79DE4DEAECF5645B4.description:
Ask or answer questions about
the details provided by the speaker.

C1361B5AFE4D4DB48657A8E5F54DC378.description:
Identify details in a text read aloud
or information presented orally or through
other media.

34CFE6D5171C439D8269C1FD652C9EDF.description:
Indicate confusion or lack of
understanding about information
presented.

9B93D9B41F7245969179DFB1FFDE5CA5.description:
Listen to others’ ideas before
responding.

96AD4D7FA73F4961B17DFFA13514B3FB.description:
Engage in collaborative interactions
about texts, pulling from prior
experiences.

47D29B97B72943D6A822CB6D928A928B.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, recall key details from literary or
informational texts and generate reflection
or inquiry questions based on a reading of a
literary or informational text.

98B4FDF4D7184A7E930604DFF82FD372.description:
Sort information on a topic or
personal experience into two provided
categories and write or draw about each
one.

51A2C8E36AB2433E9077506AC3B1C573.description:
With guidance and support,
identify information about a shared or
independent inquiry topic.

535501E0E02B4CEAAA074330837F8606.description:
With guidance and support from
adults, use digital tools to produce writing
while interacting and collaborating with
others. Learn to produce writing through
printing.

64AAEA1103374090B15A8A9F1060B6AB.description:
With guidance and support from
adults and peers, including questions or
suggestions, revise their own writing,
dictation, or pictures.

CABD4A2D47EC49E18731A3CE5A102167.description:
With guidance and support,
produce writing that is appropriate for an
explicitly stated task, and expresses more
than one idea.

1C0E3DCD6EB843DA99D00B9B23D84EE7.description:
With guidance and support, use
a combination of drawing, dictating and
writing to create a text that uses words
familiar to the student, temporal words to
signal event order, and a beginning, middle,
and end.

5F9507D68C6A4C0681CDFCEB4E5C74DD.description:
Convey events, real or imagined and
narrate a single event or several
loosely linked events. Include some
details regarding what happened
and tell about the events in the order in
which they occurred.

45A62B907EAF475594C563C34974E83D.description:
Informative/Explanatory text in which
they provide at least 2 facts about a
predetermined or self chosen topic.

43CB340AB5614C8D97E0B50DA28FE643.description:
Opinion pieces in which they state an
opinion about a topic or text and
include at least one reason to support
that opinion.

20B0469DC3B649739D633E5F897A767C.description:
With guidance and support, use
writing, dictation and/or drawing to compose:

ACE473BBCD1A42ADAB9E5E22EB0CD3F0.description:
With guidance and support, use
drawing, dictating, or writing to compose writing
for a variety of high-stakes and low-stakes
purposes.

755AEAE1977F4B408802D7EAE797EF3F.description:
Identify similarities between two
texts and recognize that texts reflect one’s
own and others’ culture. (RI&RL)

ADBE6868B94B4F25AAFEB3F9A8197797.description:
Identify two related points the
author makes in text. (RI)

C1F10D5F15364060B5ED39DF980031A1.description:
Identify parts of illustrations or
tactual information that depict story
elements. (RI&RL)

7A928C0533044FAAA46DB92F1C9638DD.description:
Identify personal point of view
about a text. (RI&RL)

AE01B92FB37146D0B16562EBE731C20B.description:
With guidance and support,
determine the beginning, middle, and end of
a familiar story with a logical order (RL) and
use text features including headings and key
words to locate information in a text (RI).

41E37B07F4EB47E791AA115711DFB786.description:
Determine words and phrases
that complete literal sentences in a
text. (RI&RL)

707E954C36874E7EA5AE6CF3D55E0646.description:
Identify the feelings of characters
in a story. (RL) Order two events from a text
as “first” and “next. (RI)

BDF35743884846CA9D9C5026A326518E.description:
Answer who and what questions
to demonstrate understanding of details in a
text. (RI&RL)

3CC2C03CB0724821AEDF5AB0F65F0361.description:
Use context to determine missing
words that impede
comprehension in familiar texts.

020A7583FFA844D0AE5CF27C8D6840AA.description:
With guidance and support, use
features of print to identify or
verbalize appropriate expression
while reading familiar texts.

DA827AD006724E31A4A513A1C65ECA3C.description:
Read words intext.
Read familiar text comprised of known
words.

D9149100EB9E4BBAB04D4D708ED8E381.description:
With models and supports, decode
and encode, in the way the child is
able, single syllable words with
common spelling patterns
(consonant-vowel- consonant[CVC]
or high frequency rimes).

1A58C3E737744C2E9E8318352F16CDF3.description:
In context, demonstrate basic
knowledge of letter-sound
correspondences.

F8409BB97A264CE182C59E5A38C0F57B.description:
Use letter-sound knowledge to
read words.
